730208f-c.title: General view - 8th Avenue - Northeast.
730208f-c.text:
80 Eighth Avenue, at the N.E. corner of West 14th
Street (County Trust Co. Building) general view northeastward.
A set of three views photographed in the direction of
Madison Square and overlooking the zone between 14th and 23rd Streets. At that point appear the 'New York Life and the Metropolitan
Buildings.
Through the foreground runs Seventh Avenue, and the prominent New York Telephone Co. Building (No. 206 West 18th Street) is to the west of same. The side of this structure seen by the viewer
is on West 17th Street.
To the right, and directly on Seventh Avenue, are two
tall structures. The first is a 12 story loft building, No. 106-110 Seventh Avenue (between 16th and 17th Streets), and the second, a new 18 story apartment house at the S.W. corner of West 18th Street. This latter structure is on the former site of the 3-story Arnold Constable and Co. stable (92-98 Seventh Avenue). In the near future another 18 story apartment will separate these buildings. This will be at the N.W. corner of 16th Street and
abut the aforementioned loft.
In the distant background appears (view 3) the R. C. A., 10 East 40th Street, Lincoln, Chanin and Chrysler Buildings.
May 31, 1930
Views 1, 2, 3
P. L. Sperr

730210f-a.title: General view - 8th Avenue - Southwest.
730210f-a.text:
80 Eighth Avenue, at the N.E. corner of West 14th Street (Sounty? Trust Wo.? Building) general view southwestward.
Two views from atop the aforementioned structure towards the North (Hudson) River and overlooking the
area to the west of Greenwich Village.
In the foreground is a small triangular block on the west side of Eighth Avenue (left corner) between West 13th and Horatio Streets. To the rear of same is West 4th Street upon which stands the large 9 story
Riker Hegenwn? Building.
May 31, 1930
Views: 1-2
L. Sperr

730210f-b.title: General view - 8th Avenue - Southwest.
730210f-b.text:

Riker Hegenwn? Building.
May 31, 1930
Views: 1-2
L. Sperr

730209f-b.title: General view - 8th Avenue - West.
730209f-b.text:
8O Eighth Avenue, at the N.E. corner of West 14th Street (County Trust Co. Building) general view westward). Three views photographed from the above location towards the North (Hudson) River to show there various west side docks and ocean liners. These extend from Tenth and Eleventh Avenue's, and West Street.
Across the foreground runs the Ninth Avenue Elevated line crossing 14th and 18th Street's (in Views 1 and 2). View 3 is slightly to the south to show Gansevoort Street to the left. At the foot of same appears the group of buildings comprising west and Washington Market.
May 31, 1930
Views: 1-2-3
P. L. Sperr
